connector.description: Send data to an AWS Redshift Database. This Kamelet expects a JSON-formatted body. Use key:value pairs to map the JSON fields and parameters.

camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.serverNa.name: camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.serverName
camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.serverNa.description: The server name for the data source. Example: localhost

camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.serverPo.name: camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.serverPort
camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.serverPo.description: The server port for the AWS RedShi data source.

camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.username.name: camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.username
camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.username.description: The username to access a secured AWS Redshift Database.

camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.password.name: camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.password
camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.password.description: The password to access a secured AWS Redshift Database.

camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.query.name: camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.query
camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.query.description: The query to execute against the AWS Redshift Database. Example: INSERT INTO accounts (username,city) VALUES (:#username,:#city)

camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.database.name: camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.databaseName
camel.kamelet.aws-redshift-sink.database.description: The name of the AWS RedShift Database.
